events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision occurring on the morning of April 30th, providing initial details about the accident and the involved vehicles.
Based on the initial report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal car in a collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned the case to guide the policyholder through the claims process and gather any additional required information.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the claim and outlining initial next steps for the policyholder.
Requested submission of the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the driver’s license for claim verification purposes.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents including the police accident report and clear images of the vehicle damages as proof.
An adjuster was assigned to investigate the circumstances of the vehicle accident to validate the claim and determine liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the policyholder was not at fault and the damage was consistent with the reported collision.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the repair costs of the vehicle and any associated rental car charges incurred during the repair.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the prompt response and clarity of the settlement proposal, thanking the agent for assistance.
The claim was officially approved for full coverage of the approved settlement amount based on the adjuster’s report and documentation.
Payment was issued to the repair shop and the policyholder’s rental car provider as agreed in the settlement terms.
The claim was closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation that the vehicle repairs were completed to the policyholder's satisfaction.
The case file was archived in the system per regulatory guidelines, with all records securely stored for future reference if needed.
